titles.title: Extension of Continuing Appropriations Act, 2021
Extension of Continuing Appropriations Act, 2021
Extension of Continuing Appropriations Act, 2021
Making further continuing appropriations for fiscal year 2021, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.
Mrs. Lowey moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.J. Res. 110.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: (2/3 required): 329 - 65 (Roll no. 248).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary:
Extension of Continuing Appropriations Act, 2021
This joint resolution provides continuing FY2021 appropriations to federal agencies through December 21, 2020. It is known as a continuing resolution (CR) and prevents a government shutdown that would otherwise occur if the FY2021 appropriations bills have not been enacted when the existing CR expires on December 20, 2020.
